title: Rhipe takes on Telstra in the consulting space
text:
"The opportunity ahead is to continue growing our subscriptions for software products while also building out our solutions portfolio."

Rhipe is currently trading at its highest point since reverse listing onto the ASX in late 2013.

The company was trading up 119 per cent for the year-to-date at $2.72 on Monday, giving it a market capitalisation of $379 million.

In its financial results for the 12 months to June 30, the software distributor grew revenue by 36 per cent to $48.4 million, while its net profit doubled to $6.2 million.

Its new consulting practice will fit into its solutions division, which also incorporates its data collaboration, management and security services.

Rhipe has appointed company veteran Warren Nolan to lead the division.

Mr Nolan, who has worked for the business for 14 years and joined when it only had six employees, said the decision to formally start a consulting practice came on the back of the success of its nSynergy acquisition and its 24/7 customer support service.

"We're seeing more resellers come on that aren't your typical service providers. They're becoming more and more the trusted advisors to small and medium sized businesses and even enterprises in terms of providing advice on what companies need to look for in terms of IT products and services," he said.

Advertisement

"These non-traditional providers don't have an IT background, but they can partner with solutions providers like ourselves to provide the implementation services and ongoing support needed to their customers."

Rhipe's consulting practice will compete with Telstra's new business unit Purple Consulting and Professional Services.

Mr Nolan said its solutions business currently made up 20 per cent of its revenue, but he expected it to make up a larger chunk going forward.

"There's a significant amount of investment going towards it. We're expanding the team to provide the services we create demand for and we've enhanced all the divisions in terms of the internal resources," he said.

"My vision is to be the leading channel-driven professional services solution provider across the Asia Pacific. There's no reason why we couldn't deliver these services across the 17 countries we're in," he said.
description: Cloud software distributor Rhipe believes its solutions business will make up a larger chunk of its revenue in the coming years.
